Reviews.Title: Great camera and easy to use too!
Reviews.Author: M.A.Dem
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to take with me on a trip to Arizona.  It was very easy to use and I was able to take some really great pictures. The only drawback (and it's a minor one), was that I missed the view finder. I only missed it when there was too much sun to see the LCD screen.  Otherwise, great little camera!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Emilio "rufusndufus"
Reviews.Content: Nice little camera.  Rarely takes a bad photo.  Nice resolution, color.  Fairly fast.  Good video with sound too.

Reviews.Title: Good and durable
Reviews.Author: R. taran
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty good camera for the money. I don't care too much about mega pixels; I wanted a name brand that had a 3x zoom at a low cost, this E30 fit the bill. This camera comes with some of the best software available in my opinion. The E30 is also durable. I accidentally slung it across the sidewalk about 15feet (it slipped from my hand). Just a minor scratch is all that happened. For $115.00 this camera is a bargain

Reviews.Title: Easy to use, long battery life
Reviews.Author: Robert W. Sharp "Rob_S"
Reviews.Content: I bought rechargeables (AA-2500mh) with the camera and they last a very long time--through video (quite good, sound too), flash, and a variety of settings and uses. I'm pleased.Contols are super-easy to learn. I previously had a Pentax that died after about 4 years, and can tell you it was a hard-sell to get me to buy another. I liked how it felt after a trial run; this camera improved virtually all the weak areas of the old Optio 430-shutter lag (better, not instant), controls, tactile button feel, etc.Screen is good-automatically dims slightly to save energy after a few seconds but brightens up instantly when you touch a button.Only two very minor demerits:1) no viewfinder (bright sun makes it a little difficult to see the screen, but camera orientation still makes it easy to get the shot), and2) flash strength - the flash has fairly limited distance; fine for indoor shots, a bit of a challenge for shots past 10 feet or so.Really great camera and value for the price.

Reviews.Title: New Camera
Reviews.Author: Frank Bratjan
Reviews.Content: I checked out a few cameras and found this was the best buy. It is a top brand, Easy to use, Outstanding features, And the price I could not pass up. Picture quality is excellent

Reviews.Title: Good for the money - BUT BROKEN NOW
Reviews.Author: Avid Reader
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a trip I will be taking based on the reviews & the price. The pictures I have taken so far are good, except at beach. Without a viewfinder the screen is a mirror in the bright sun. Also, the description of the camera said that the batteries would last for 200 pictures. Not true at all. I only got 24 pictures out of the batteries, perhaps because it was so difficult to see in the sun and it took so long to take pictures. Guess I will take a bag of batteries on my upcoming trip to Italy!Post Script to above review: used the camera on my trip to Italy and it was excellent!!! Took almost 200 pictures & only had to change batteries once. The battery seems to recharge itself..battery indicator sometimes reads yellow then next time you use camera it's green -- so you get lots of pictures.  Pictures came out great..still miss viewfinder, but this is a great camera for the money.Post-post-script: On May 18, 2008, less than one year after purchase of this camera, the lcd monitor inexplicably broke - did not drop it, no undue handling - camera was in my jacket pocket.  Pentax claims the damage was my fault & it's not covered under warranty. $97 to fix a $99 camera!!! Absurd!! Was great camera until it broke. Went to Italy & back with no problems & took great pictures.  Never thought I had to handle camera like it was a raw egg, if you get my drift - so still don't know how monitor broke.  DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA!!

Reviews.Title: Amazing Camera!! Highly recommended
Reviews.Author: Jack Major
Reviews.Content: This camera is the best digital camera I have ever used.  The menus are intuitive and the ease of operation is unmatched.  The photo quality is impeccable and the videos are amazing.  The sound quality is great and there is no chop in the framing.  I have used this camera for high speed sporting events and it looks like every shot was a photo that was posed.

Reviews.Title: it's not bad
Reviews.Author: Maia M. Racheva
Reviews.Content: for this price- camera is ok.it's nice, menu is easy to navigate.it doesn't have viewfinder and this is real disadvantage.macro mode really sucks....and the zoom is little noisy...but unless you've got focus, the picture will be good.true point-and-shoot camera.if you want more-have to pay more:))

Reviews.Title: Its great for the price
Reviews.Author: S. Cruse
Reviews.Content: The camera itself is great for the price. The only thing I miss is the view finder. Tried to take pictures in Badlands Nat.Park The sun was in my face so the LCD screen was very hard to see. The pictures from the camera are great. Overall its a good deal.

Reviews.Title: Eats batteries
Reviews.Author: H. C. "Helen C"
Reviews.Content: I bought a Pentax Optio E30 a few months ago. After taking a few pictures (10-15) I had to replace the batteries. The new batteries lasted only 2-3 days and I only used the camera for less than an hour. I bought a charger and some rechargeable Ni-Mh batteries. They don't fare any better than the alkaline. I very seldom use this camera and the batteries go dead just sitting in the camera for 2 to 4 weeks. I would not recommend this camera to anyone I liked.

Reviews.Title: nice little camera
Reviews.Author: K. Allwood "uhuratrek"
Reviews.Content: GOOD VALUE. TAKES DECENT PICTURES.THIS IS MY FIRST DIGITAL CAMERA, AND I AM VERY HAPPY WITH MY CHOICE.

Reviews.Title: Good pictures, bad hardware
Reviews.Author: M. Schwindt
Reviews.Content: This made in China camera takes really good pictures, but after 1 year of few use both the zoom button and right arrow key (macro) stopped working (and also the pictures' display did). The miss of a viewer is a pity, and it takes to much energy of batteries (it lasts less of 100 pictures, average use).
